TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1444-1445
TEI.2.document_title: Green DeWitt to Stephen F. Austin, 09-03-1826

barker_notes.barker_summary: Green De Witt to Austin, September 3, 1826. Indians. Transportation. Colony affairs.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1444-1445

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Green De Witt to Austin, September 3, 1826. Indians. Transportation. Colony affairs.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*Station On *location_mentioned*Rio Labaca*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="09-03-1826">Sept 3rd 1826*/date_mentioned*.*/p* *p*Dr Sir*/p*
*p*This will inform you I have stationed myself for the present on this *location_mentioned*creek */location_mentioned* *location_mentioned*a bout 6 miles above the head of tide water*/location_mentioned*, where I intend settling some 10 or 12 *person_mentioned*families */person_mentioned*in the form of a station in order that we may be more secure from the *person_mentioned*Indians */person_mentioned*untill we can collect strength enough to venture out on our *location_mentioned*lands*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*I should have written you before this time, but have been so undetermined in the place where I would actually settle for the present; and so much occupied in moving out from the *location_mentioned*bay */location_mentioned*that I had not time to write you, which neglect I hope you will pardon.*/p*
*p*I have contracted for the runing of the Schooner Despatch, *person_mentioned*W. J. Russell, master,*/person_mentioned* for the term of 4 years—she has made her first trip; and is a new vessel only 18 months old; burthen 50 Tons and well Edged, I have also contracted for the building of a flat boat 30 by 12 feet, which is already begun; for which is for the purpose of unload- ing and lighting the schooner so that she can pass in at the*location_mentioned* mouth of the Labaca*/location_mentioned*—the schooner will be at the *location_mentioned*landing */location_mentioned*a gain in about 3 weeks, with some *person_mentioned*Emigrants */person_mentioned*and [al]so some cargo for this *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*. I have also contracted for the building of a *location_mentioned*ware house*/location_mentioned* *location_mentioned*at or near the mouth of the Labaca*/location_mentioned* which will be immediately commenced for the convenience of *person_mentioned*emigrants */person_mentioned*and others destined for either of these *location_mentioned*colonies*/location_mentioned*, that their *person_mentioned*property */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*families */person_mentioned*may have a place of shelter and safety on landing in this vast *location_mentioned*wilderness*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Mr Kerr*/person_mentioned* has just returned from *person_mentioned*San Antonio*/person_mentioned* and will be able to give you all the News of that place; touching my business with the Government.*/p*
*p*If you should write shortly to *person_mentioned*Baron De Bastrop*/person_mentioned* I would wish to be particularly remembered to him; inform him what I am doing etc etc and that I will shortly write hiin lengthly,*/p*
*p*When on my way to this *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*I called at landing of *location_mentioned*Mr Elias Bates*/location_mentioned* in order to ask for letters for you and your *person_mentioned*brother*/person_mentioned*; but was informed by *person_mentioned*Mr John Geizer*/person_mentioned* that none of the *person_mentioned*family */person_mentioned*were at *location_mentioned*home*/location_mentioned* and that *person_mentioned*Mrs Bates*/person_mentioned* and *person_mentioned*Mrs Honey*/person_mentioned* were both dead.*/p*
*p*I intend visiting you so soon as I can leave this place with safety, when I shall have many things to say and much advice to ask of you, as *person_mentioned*Empresarios */person_mentioned*have much trouble to en counter, but I the most of all; your assistance to *person_mentioned*Mr Kerr*/person_mentioned* has been deeply felt by him and equally so by me. My compliments to *person_mentioned*Mr Williams*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*G. Dewitt*/person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Col Stephen F Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
